hint.text: Represent the square number as a product of its prime factors

solution.text:
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_\) can be represented as a product of its prime factors as :
\(=_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ _{{('\\times'+ str(l)+'^'+str(o)) if (o>0) else ''}}_\)
Therefore, \(\sqrt{_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_}=\sqrt{_{j}_^_{m}_ \times _{k}_^_{n}_ _{{('\\times'+ str(l)+'^'+str(o)) if (o>0) else ''}}_}\)
\(=_{j}_^_{{m/2}}_ \times _{k}_^_{{n/2}}_ _{{('\\times'+ str(l)+'^'+str(o/2)) if (o>0) else ''}}_\)
\(=_{{((j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o))**(Decimal(str(0.5)))}}_\)

content.text: What is the square root of the square number \(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_\)?
